This is a bit of a complex question to answer and it depends, I think, more on your preferences and experiences you are seeking. You can find small, biodynamic vineyards with production less than 20,000 bottles as well as larger operations producing mass quantities of DOCG wines. I think the more important experience begins with finding a product you love and going directly to the source. Smell the air, dig into the ground, explore the area, and talk to the families and groups who produce the wine. They willingly talk with great pride about what they produce. Of course it’s a picturesque experience because of where you are, but if you want to be inspired, go to the source of your inspiration. Most people do superficial drive-by “tours” of prescribed places and completely miss what makes Italy the beautiful place it is. Dig in to some enology and regional research and go put your feet in the dirt. 🙂 I do frequent buying and research trips to places and people producing what I love and it enriches the experience.
